basic.floral_language:
Lobelia cardinalis 
Floriography: rationality, freedom, delicate
Lobelia cardinalis is a herb with beautiful lanceolate leaves and flowers of slender petals with elegant colors. Flowers half open, hence named "lobelia". Suitable for flower beds or home landscaping, known for medicinal value of detoxification as well.
Lobelia cardinalis likes full sun, but requires proper shelter to avoid summer strong sunlight. Blossom period in May to August over 1-2 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period May-August, viewing period 1-2 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like adequate light, shade properly under summer strong light
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
